lead_paragraph: Few students applying to college write about their family financial situations. But those who take the risk — whether poor or well-off — can stand out from the crowd.

headline.main: Essays About Work and Class That Caught a College’s Eye

snippet: Few students applying to college write about their family financial situations. But those who take the risk — whether poor or well-off — can stand out from the crowd.
abstract: Ron Lieber Your Money column highlights seven college essays selected together with Julie Lythcott-Haims, former Stanford dean and author of How to Raise an Adult; notes those that stand out from crowded thousands of undergraduate admissions touch upon deeply personal topics.
